data: ICU Continuous Renal Replacement (CRRT) - Critical Care Only (Adult)
This PowerPlan is to be re-ordered WEEKLY by Intensivist, Critical Care Fellow, or Clinical Associate.
Fluid removal orders should be reviewed and modified as necessary daily
Physician to adjust antibiotic, supplements and enteral feed doses at start of CRRT
Flush dialysis catheter with sodium chloride 0.9% 10 mL, then instill and lock catheter lumens with sodium citrate 4% up to the volume noted on each individual port
Enter the net fluid removal in either mL/h or mL/day
instillation, q4h interval, PRN, other (see comment)
Discontinue all ICU Electrolyte Replacement Protocol Orders when patient is on CRRT.  New orders for these protocols must be reordered when CRRT is stopped, as required.
Refer to facility's IV drug dosing guidelines during renal replacement therapy
vitamin B with C renal (RENAVITE or REPLAVITE EQUIV) tab
1 tab, NG-tube, qdaily, drug form: tab
100 mg, IV, qdaily, drug form: inj
100 mg, NG-tube, qdaily, drug form: tab
Basic Metabolic Panel (Lytes, Urea, Creat, Gluc)
Blood, AM Draw, Unit collect, Collection: T+1;0330, qdaily for 7 day
Electrolytes Panel (Na, K, Cl, CO2, Anion Gap)
Blood, Timed, Unit collect, Collection: T;N, q4h interval for 3 doses or times
Blood, AM Draw, Unit collect, Collection: T+1;0330, qdaily for 7 day
Blood, AM Draw, Unit collect, Collection: T+1;0330, qdaily for 7 day
heparin 5000 units in sodium chloride 0.9% 1L; followed by sodium chloride 0.9% 1L
If/when potassium is less than 5.5 mmol/L, then select PRISMASOL 4 for all solutions
If/when potassium is greater than or equal to 5.5 mmol/L, then select PRISMASOL 0 for all solutions and check Electrolytes Panel q4h
Initiate only after the CRRT run has begun, then adjust accordingly to maintain normothermic state (36.5 to 37.5 C)
Excess Patient Fluid Loss or Gain Limit
12.5 mL/kg/h of dosing weight.  Round to the nearest 100 mL
